Below the siphons is the pharynx with its three rows of numerous stigmcta (visceral
clefts)., It opens into a short esophagus which connects with a round yellow stomach
marked by muscular bsndes The intestine turns sharply after leaving the stomach., and
ends near the atrial siphon. The endostyle is sharply indicated on the wall of the 
pharynx; delimiting the two atrial pouchesr These pouches surround the pharynx and
open to the exterior at the atrial siphons
do Izjpioardial buddgge Asexual reproduction of new individuals may be seen in
laboratory cultures about 17 days after attachment of the tedpoles Or, swarms of buds
in all stages of growth and migration can usually be found st the bases of the tiniest
transparent finger-like lobes of a large healthy colonys
Asexual reproduction is accomplished by Strobilization, 1939 segmentation of the
post-abdomen which contains the epicsrdiel strands The buds consist at of inner
vesicle (from epicsrdiuxn) and outer covering (from parent epidemic), All internal
organs of the new individuals form from the epicardium tissue, which me a. pharyngeal
derivative, Lea endoderm. The epicardiel buds while differentiating into new sooids
move up and take their place around the parent., Dsring the strobilization of the
parent' post-abdomen, the old heart is isolated and degenerates, and new heart is
regenerated :Ln the parents

2. is another compound Ascidian, which is found encrusting
on rocks, and floats., Certain colonies? brought into the laboratory and placed

If the normally-1-shed tadpoles are placed in e. little sea water in a watch glass, they
